Gorman began his television career with a three episode appearance on [[Coronation Street]] as Ben Andrews. He is most well known for appearing in the first two seasons of the BAFTA Cymru winning science-fiction/crime drama ''[[Torchwood]]'' as [[Owen Harper]]. In 2007 he filmed ''[[Sex, The City and Me]]'' for the BBC and "[[Ordeal by Innocence]]", an episode of ''[[Marple (TV series)|Marple]]'' for ITV. Recently, he has worked with cult Spanish director [[Ãlex de la Iglesia]] on ''[[The Oxford Murders]]'', a crime thriller based on Guillermo Martinez's book of the same name alongside [[Elijah Wood]] and [[John Hurt]]. He also appeared in the film ''[[Fred Claus]]'' with [[Vince Vaughn]] and [[Kevin Spacey]].
Gorman began his television career with a three episode appearance on [[Coronation Street]] as Ben Andrews. He is most well known for appearing in the first two seasons of the BAFTA Cymru winning science-fiction/crime drama ''[[Torchwood]]'' as [[Owen Harper]]. In 2007 he filmed ''[[Sex, The City and Me]]'' for the BBC and "[[Ordeal by Innocence]]", an episode of ''[[Marple (TV series)|Marple]]'' for ITV. Recently, he has worked with cult Spanish director [[Ãlex de la Iglesia]] on ''[[The Oxford Murders]]'', a crime thriller based on Guillermo Martinez's book of the same name alongside [[Elijah Wood]] and [[John Hurt]]. He also appeared in the film ''[[Fred Claus]]'' with [[Vince Vaughn]] and [[Kevin Spacey]].
â
Gorman's other film credits include ''[[Layer Cake (film)|Layer Cake]]'' (directed by [[Matthew Vaughn]]), ''[[Penelope (2006 film)|Penelope]]'' (with [[Christina Ricci]] and [[Reese Witherspoon]]), ''[[The Best Man]]'', ''[[Colour Me Kubrick]]'', ''Love is Not Enough'', and the short films ''The Bully Boys'' and ''[[Runners (short film)|Runners]]''.Oxford murders
+
Gorman's other film credits include ''[[Layer Cake (film)|Layer Cake]]'' (directed by [[Matthew Vaughn]]), ''[[Penelope (2006 film)|Penelope]]'' (with [[Christina Ricci]] and [[Reese Witherspoon]]), ''[[The Best Man]]'', ''[[Colour Me Kubrick]]'', ''Love is Not Enough'', and the short films ''The Bully Boys'' and ''[[Runners (short film)|Runners]]''.
â  
Gorman appeared in the BAFTA winning [[BBC One]] adaptation of [[Charles Dickens]]' ''[[Bleak House (2005)|Bleak House]]'' as William Guppy, and the BAFTA nominated political thriller ''Low Winter Sun'' ([[Tiger Aspect Productions|Tiger Aspect]]/[[Channel 4]]) the same year. In 2008 he played scriptwriter [[Ray Galton]] in the [[BBC Four]] [[television play]], ''[[The Curse of Steptoe]]''.
Gorman appeared in the BAFTA winning [[BBC One]] adaptation of [[Charles Dickens]]' ''[[Bleak House (2005)|Bleak House]]'' as William Guppy, and the BAFTA nominated political thriller ''Low Winter Sun'' ([[Tiger Aspect Productions|Tiger Aspect]]/[[Channel 4]]) the same year. In 2008 he played scriptwriter [[Ray Galton]] in the [[BBC Four]] [[television play]], ''[[The Curse of Steptoe]]''.
